message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.CR, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with consensus in distributed systems, which is a classic problem in distributed computing. The paper also introduces new classes of failure detectors and shows how they can be implemented in homonymous systems. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The paper also discusses synchrony requirements and partial synchrony, which makes cs.SY (Systems and Control) a likely sub-category as well. The paper also deals with fault tolerance and failure detection, which makes cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper presents algorithms for solving consensus, which makes cs.LG (Machine Learning) a possible sub-category as well.
